StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Novel Gene-Environment Regulatory Circuit in Chamber-Specific Growth of Perinatal Heart

SLOAN-KETTERING INST CAN RESEARCHUNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA LOS ANGELES

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: This work was supported by grant 5R01HL153853 to M. Touma from the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI), a part of the National Institutes of Health (NIH). For publications, written, and/or oral presentations resulting from use of this data, please cite the following information: “The original data description for [Whole Exome Sequencing Identifies Compound Heterozygous Variants in the Mitochondrial Transcription elongation Factor (TSFM) Gene Causing Juvenile Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy] can be found here: (Journal Citation) (PMID: Pending). The original data used for the analysis in this publication can be found in the NIH database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) under the accession number phs______.”
Policy.ic_specific_access_term:
There are two consent groups for this study:
1) Disease-Specific (Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy, IRB, MDS, GSO) DS-HC-IRB-MDS-GSO Use of the data must be related to Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Only full or expedited approvals are acceptable, and an ANNUAL IRB review is required base on the informed consents from the submitting institution. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms). Use of the data is limited to genetic studies only.
2) Health/Medical/Biomedical (IRB, MDS, GSO) HMB-IRB-MDS-GSO Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Only full or expedited approvals are acceptable, and an ANNUAL IRB review is required base on the informed consents from the submitting institution. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms). Use of the data is limited to genetic studies only.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)
